name: The Nadler Kensington

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel mainly due to the reviews on Trip Advisor and also due to the location being near to Hyde Park as we were staying one night for the Hyde Park Calling events in london.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel, great location and price
nice remodeled hotel, easy access to the underground
reviews.text: Loved the location of this hotel, very easy to find, friendly reception staff, easy check in, room was nice (although not as amazing as I was expecting from the reviews on here, but it was modern, clean and bright with a nice bathroom and shower and mini kitchen plus utensils) good sized flatscreen tv, room wasn't huge but served its purpose for us both. Check out was also stress free and we left our bags while we explored more of the capital the next day. All in all a great stay, wouldn't hesitate on recommending this hotel to friends and family, felt very safe walking back here from the tube late at night too, lovely area aswell.

the hotel is slated as being green and you definitely could tell once you were inside, clean lines, nice materials and overall just nice rooms that you can tell had bee recently upgraded/redone. the rooms have flat screens and actually have internet access with a wireless keyboard to surf the web on the tv, which was convenient, though a little slow. Although this was adequate to check email and send messages to others back in the states. You can also book trips and also get tickets to events or the red bus that will take you around London at the front desk, a time-saving option. Earl's Court station is only a few minutes walk from the hotel, and it is very easy to travel via the underground to get to many of London's attractions. It would have been nice to be a little closer to the historical district near Westminster, though I'm sure this would come with a much larger price tag. Located right down the street are a few pubs such as the Blackbird and also the Courtfield although they did close early (like 11 or 12). The Courtfied seemed a little more lively, was open later and I think just overall I had a better time there as it had a different vibe, Blackbird had good bangers and mash. Overall the area was very nice and we could tell the neighborhood was upscale, as we saw maserati's in driveways and an aston martin just parked on the street. One mistake we did make was that we didn't buy the London Pass, I feel like we would have seem more sites if we did, as the cost of each individual site really added up with how strong the pound is to the dollar, look into the London Pass.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: We stayed for a family vacation, 2 adults and 2 kids, we rented 2 separate rooms. The hotel staff was excellent, very friendly, efficient and helpful. The rooms were typically small, but very clean and well kept. They were nicely appointed and although small, the space was efficient. Free wifi, refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave were also a plus.
reviews.title: We loved it and recommend it.

reviews.text: Outstanding location, approximately 3-4 minute walk to Earls Court tube. Earls court tube services the Picadilly and District lines, which made it very easy to get almost anywhere in the city. There were also restaurants, pubs and convenience stores within a 5 minute walk. Would stay here again on my next visit to London.
reviews.title: An uneven experience

reviews.text: Just returned from a 5-day stay at Base2Stay with my teen daughter and totally agree with the other reviews that I've been reading over the last 6 months! So easy to get to - we got our Oyster Passes (easy/cheap way to ride the Underground) at Heathrow, took the tube right to Earls Court, and walked the short block to the hotel. Even though we were early, we immediately got our room, and were very impressed: spotless, nicely furnished, great bathroom facilities, wonderful little 'kitchen', and as we found out that night, superb bedding. Staff was wonderful, room was wonderful, neighborhood was convenient, with many interesting places to eat, close to busses and underground.. We were extremely pleased!
reviews.title: Perfect Place to Stay in London!

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for four nights, two adults and a small child. We loved it. The hotel is nice, modern, pleasant staff and very convenient. The rooms are small, but that was expected in London. Easy walking distance to the tube and grocery stores/coffee shops. We walked to the museums nearby and thought the neighborhood was very pretty and quiet. We had a family room on the ground level and were pleased that it also had a private patio- a nice plus! Would highly recommend this hotel. London was unseasonably hot the week we were in town and I was very happy that I booked a hotel with air conditioning!
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second stay within 6 months. The first time, we stayed for 5 nights in a "standard double". The room was just the right size for two people. Although, you definitely need the space under the bed for your luggage to have any room to move. During our second stay, we stayed for 3 nights in a "double/twin" room. The room was almost twice the size of the "standard double".
reviews.title: Great Place for a Great Price

reviews.text: Place was always immaculately clean. The in-room internet access was handy, but it did take some getting used to and you can't view PDF files with it. Location was great as it was a short 3 min walk to the nearest Tube stop (Earl's Court) and a ton of restaurants. There are also two handy self-serve laundry facilities nearby (on the same street as the tube stop).
reviews.title: Good place for exploring London

likes.liked: — Well appointed and maintained; good location

reviews.text: As long as the quality is kept, we don't think we'll be using any other place whenever we visit London.
reviews.title: Excellent London base

reviews.text: We stayed at Base2Stay for a 3 night visit to London.
reviews.title: Fantastic for a short stay

reviews.text: It is a wonderful modern hotel, very clean (fantastic shower!), about a 5-10 min walk from Earl's Court tube station (even with big suitcases). Rooms are small so it is probably better for a shorter stay.
reviews.title: I'll be back!

reviews.text: Highly recommended, would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: We expected better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a wonderful little hotel in a lovely neighbourhood (two tube stations are very close so one's in the City Centre in no time). The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful, our room was lovely (to the back, airy, full of light, great furniture and bathroom).
reviews.title: Beyond our expectations!

reviews.text: If there was a downside, it could only be the fact that one heard the other guests a little too well (walking, door slamming..), but I couldn't blame that on the hotel at all.
reviews.title: A real gem

reviews.text: Our group of 6 stayed at Base2Stay in late June for 5 nights as part of our European vacation. We had 2 rooms (triples). One room was on the lower ground and the other on the first floor. The rooms were modern, clean, quiet, and very pleasant. The kitchenette was very convenient. The presence of a small fridge, microwave, kettle, plates, and utensils made our visit to London much easier, since we were able to have breakfast in our rooms. This saved a lot of time in the mornings so we could head out earlier to enjoy London. It also made things easier for evening snacks etc.
reviews.title: Great Choice

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is very good. It is on the Piccadilly line (direct from Heathrow), so taking the Underground Tube from the airport to the hotel was very easy and economical. The Tube station "Earl's Court" is a 3 minute walk. The area felt safe. The hotel is in a mostly residential area with some other hotels and shops mixed in.
reviews.title: Great comfort, superb value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Earl's Court Rd (were you exit from the tube) has many little stores and places to eat (including Subway sandwiches, Baker's oven, and other fast food). Marks & Spencer Simply Food was an especially convenient little grocery store. You can purchase items for breakfast the night before. It also has a wide selection of ready to eat meals (not frozen) that can be microwaved in your room is you choose. Barclay's bank ATM machines and a post office are directly across the street from the Earl's Court Tube station. There is coin laundry on a nearby street. This was useful for us as we needed to do laundry before continuing our vacation in Paris.
reviews.title: What a gem!

reviews.text: The location was great for taking the tube to most of London's biggest attraction sites. This is very important because you can totally eliminate the need for taking expensive taxis. Earl's Court tube station has 2 key lines (Picadilly and District) and the underground system is extremely easy to use.
reviews.title: Excellent modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had 2 minor incoveniences at this hotel which were corrected during our first evening there. The bathtub/shower drains extremely slowly (this was the case in both of our rooms). The staff used a liquid product in the drain to improve this and it was better by the next day. The fridge was unplugged in both rooms, and it took a long time to cool it down. We realized this only after doing our groceries, so check to make sure your fridge is plugged in when you first check in. The plug is behind the garbage can inside the kitchinette closet.
reviews.title: I can't wait to stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for three days in June. We were looking forward to staying at the hotel as we had heard many positive reviews. We were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel! Great location! Would highly recommend this hotel.

reviews.text: The hotel staff are very friendly and accommodating. We received excellent service throughout our stay. They were very helpful in getting us transportation to Heathrow airport. They also provided us excellent recommendations / discounts for nearby restaurants. We were also able to get discount tickets for the Tower of London.
reviews.title: Never again!!!

reviews.text: The room we stayed in was small but well laid out. We were very happy to have our own mini fridge, glasses, utensils, etc.
reviews.title: Three cheers for base2stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shower is very large and up to date. The bathroom was lovely.
reviews.title: Boutique feel at a bargain price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When the wireless internet was down, the staff gave us access to the wired internet connection for free.
reviews.title: Excelent, feels like a little apartment for a young couple

reviews.text: I booked this Hotel based on the reviews on tripadvisor and was not disappointed. The Hotel is lovely and clean, very quiet and in a great location. I had booked for 6 nights in a single room but my brother arrived for 4 of them and the staff managed to accommodate us in a bigger room although they were heavily booked. I enjoyed every minute of my stay and was made to feel that nothing was too much trouble by the staff. I will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect London stay!

reviews.text: Chose the hotel based on reviews and was not disappointed. Was given room L6, at the basement, but with an own terrace, which made the room feel even more like a home.
reviews.title: Perfect Base

reviews.text: + good free wifi, no problems anywhere in the room
reviews.title: Great price and location.

reviews.text: + lovely shower and bathroom, both spacious
reviews.title: Worked very well for a short stay in London

reviews.text: + room bigger than expected
reviews.title: This hotel fails to meet its aspirations

reviews.text: Based on the hotel's website, and the reviews on TripAdvisor, I chose base2stay for my recent visit to London. I was not disappointed. The room was very clean, and while my single was quite snug, it had everything I needed.
reviews.title: quite happy

likes.liked: — the kitchenette, and the email access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I especially enjoyed the kitchenette feature, as I could sleep in a bit, and have a late breakfast on my own schedule. The maid would do the washing up every day. I also appreciated the beautiful shower, and the high ceilings. The curtain rods made an excellent place to dry laundry.
reviews.title: Perfect price & place.

reviews.text: The room comes with a booklet filled with information on how the "mod cons" work, and also, information on local resources, such as supermarkets. I especially liked the new Sainsbury's--it's huge.
reviews.title: clean but far far from everything

likes.liked: — INTERNET CONNECTION THROUG TV IN ROOM

reviews.text: The hotel is only a block from Earls Court tube stop, and I discovered that there are no stairs walking to the Picadilly platform, which is great if you're toting luggage on your way to Heathrow.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended!!!

likes.liked: — friendly, clean and more than I expected

reviews.text: The keyboard you use to access the internet is a little tricky, but I eventually got the hang of it. I was emailing friends and family almost every day, simply because it was convenient. I also liked listening to the BBC Radio on the telly.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: My son and I stayed here in July of this year. We tried 2 different rooms. One with twin beds and the other being the bunk beds. Both rooms had the same amenities. Given the chance to return to this hotel I would chose to stay my whole time in the bunk bed room. The beds were just as comfortable as the other but the cost would have been less. My son is 16 and had no problem sleeping or climbing to the top bunk. Other than that I would just like to repeat what others have said in relation to the hotel itself. The staff was helpful, hotel was clean and well care for, location was close to the tube and many nice restaurants nearby. Our favorite was Zizi's just by the Earls Court tube and a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Best Italian restaurant I've been to and would definitely return. One suggestion would be that a person should take in the wonderful museums close by and within walking distance. We really enjoyed London and all its charms.
reviews.title: no regrets.....

reviews.text: Ater reading all the raves about Base2Stay, we decided to book a few night's stay for part of our month-long visit to England this year. As previous guests have stated, the rooms are equipped with modern, clean decor and amenities, such as air-conditioning, a kitchenette, and luxurious towels and bed-sheets.
reviews.title: Nice Amenities - Location is Not Teriffic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our double room was indeed tiny, and after a few nights, we were glad to be departing for larger digs, as we found the room to be too small to stay in for any duration while awake. There's just one chair, so if two people do want to eat in the room (with the microwave, fridge, etc., it seems guests are encouraged to do so..), then one person must sit on the bed and squeeze into a tiny space by the desk/table.
reviews.title: Best nights sleep EVER in a London Hotel

likes.liked: — Quality of accomodation,position.quietness of area,helpful staff

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is the factor that will keep us from returning. Yes, it's close to the Earl's Court tube station, and a Marks & Spencer mini grocery and a Starbucks, etc., but it isn't really within walking distance of anything besides the retailers on Earls Court Rd. If you enjoy parks, museums, walks with LondonWalks, etc., then you must rely on public transport to get where you want to go. The immediate area around the hotel is residential, so there's nowhere for a hotel guest to be except in their tiny room or in a restaurant/Starbucks on Earl's Court Road! As for the Earls Court tube - it's fine as long as it's up and running. We met with delays and suspension of service more than once at this station, which, by the way, requires users to be really clear about the directions they're heading if wanting to travel on the Circle line. We observed perplexed visitors as well as locals at this station, due to unclear directions. Gloucester Road and South Kensington tube stops became our preferred means of transport on the Circle or District lines.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: We went to a concert at the O2 and were concerned at the suitability of the hotel as regards transport accessibility.We needed have no concerns as it is 5 mins walk from Earls Court tube.
reviews.title: A gem of a hotel!

likes.disliked: — It can be hard to book at short notice

description: The original base2stay hotel, now called The Nadler Kensington is an exciting hotel concept in London, located in a fabulous location next to a quiet Kensington Garden Square. This original townhouse and mews has been interior designed to provide all guest rooms with air-conditioning, free Wi-Fi, HDTVs with 6,000 track music library, internet and games, mini-kitchen, 24-hr Reception & Concierge Service, daily maid service and oversized power showers or baths. The Nadler Kensington has excellent transport connections and is in close walking distance of Earl's Court tube station.
